name: Dr. Ambesh Kumar
bio: Ambesh Kumar is working as Assistant Professor in KIIT, Bhubaneswar since Dec. 2017. He graduated in Mechanical Engineering in the year 2010 from WBUT, Kolkata. Subsequently he pursued M Tech degree in 2012 from NIT, Durgapur. After that he obtained his PhD degree from IIT Guwahati in Machine Design specialization. His research area includes Structural Vibration Control, Composite materials, Finite element analysis , etc. He has several SCI international journal papers against his name.

name: Dr. Amlana Panda
role: Associate Professor and Assistant Registrar (R & D)
bio: Dr. Amlana Panda, Associate Professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT University, holds a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering and has over 20 years of teaching and research experience. His expertise lies in Manufacturing, Metal Cutting, and Sustainable Machining. He has published 115 research papers, book chapters, and a textbook titled “Sustainable Hard Machining: Implementation and Assessment” (CRC Press, Taylor & Francis), with over 1300 citations and an H-index of 20. Dr. Panda’s research focuses on sustainable high-speed machining, lubrication techniques, and tool wear analysis. He has guided three Ph.D. and M.Tech. students and co-authored two textbooks. A lifetime ISTE member, he has reviewed over 575 papers for top journals and developed innovative hybrid metal matrix composite fabrication techniques integrating materials and manufacturing research.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Manufacturing Processes, Metal Cutting, Industrial Engineering and Operations Research, Engineering Metrology, Scientific and Technical Writing, Universal Human Values
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Environmental benign machining, in particular, dry and minimal quantity lubrication, NanoMQL Turning/Milling, machinability, tool wear analysis, surface integrity Sustainable Machining of Difficult-to-Machine Materials Synthesis and Characterization of Metal Matrix Nano Composite Mechanical Testing, Nano/Composite Materials Machining of Hybrid nanocomposite composites

name: Dr. Anish Pandey
bio: Dr. Anish Pandey earned his Ph.D. in Robotics and Control (Mechanical Engineering – Design) from NIT Rourkela in 2016. His research focuses on bio-inspired optimization, fuzzy logic, neural networks, and evolutionary algorithms for robot motion and orientation control. With over eight years of post-Ph.D. teaching and research experience, he serves as Assistant Professor II (Level-11) at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University. Dr. Pandey has published 36 papers (21 SCI/SCIE and 15 Scopus/WoS), holds 17 granted and 33 filed patents, and has over 2,500 Google Scholar citations. He teaches Machine Design, Mechatronics, FEM, and AI-based manufacturing. His ongoing projects include autonomous cleaning, articulated, and humanoid robots, alongside a sponsored project from TIH IIT Guwahati and various consultancy assignments.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Robotics, ML, Industry 4.0, Mechatronics, Machine Design

name: Dr. Ashwani Kumar
bio: Dr. Ashwani Kumar is a researcher and academic specializing in machine condition monitoring, lubricant analysis, vibration diagnostics, and neuromorphic sensing. He focuses on improving equipment performance through innovative, practical solutions. He holds a Ph.D. from IIT (ISM) Dhanbad, an M.Tech. in Mechatronics from IIITDM Jabalpur, and a B.E. from UIT, Barkatullah University. He also completed two years of postdoctoral research at Luleå University of Technology, Sweden. A dedicated contributor to R&D and industrial consultancy, he has published widely and actively mentors future engineers.

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Postdoctral Fellow Researcher from Lulea, Sweden; Phd. from IIT-ISM Dhanbad, India; Master of Technology in Mechatronics from IIIT Jabalpur, India; Bachelore of Eengineering in Mechanical Engineering from University Institute of Technology, BU, Bhopal, India
COURSE EXPERTISE: Machine Maintenance; Condition Monitoring; Mechatronics System; Mechanics of Solids
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Machine Condition Monitoring; Lubricant; Vibration analysis; Tribology; Mechatronics
Awards and Achievements: Most Promising Young Researcher Award at “All India seminar on Major advances andsustainable developments in lubrication domain”, 13-14 September 2018, organized jointly byTata Steel Ltd., NLGI and The Institutions of Engineers (India), Jamshedpur.

name: Dr. Asish Kumar Panda
bio: Dr. Asish Kumar Panda is currently working as an assistant professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT University, Odisha, India. Dr. Asish has received his Doctoral degree (Ph.D.) from School of Mechanical Engineering , Indian Institute of Technology Delhi. He has completed his Master’s degree from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati and Bachelor’s degree from Biju Patnaik University of Technology in Mechanical Engineering. He has more than 3 years of teaching and research experiences. His research interests broadly include FE model updating, Dynamic analysis of structures, Uncertainty quantification, Experimental modal analysis, Noise and Vibration analysis, Condition monitoring and fault diagnosis..

COURSE EXPERTISE: Vibration, Finite Element Methods, Experimental Modal analysis, Kinematics and Dynamics of Machine
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Finite Element model updating, Modal analysis, static and dynamic analysis of structures, Structural Health monitoring
Administrative Responsibilities: Website development
Outreach Activity: Delivered expert lectures on Dynamic Analysis of CNT based Composite Structures at Mechanical Engg. department NIT Rourkela, Odisha (2024)

name: Dr. Asit Behera
bio: Asit Behera is an Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering at KIIT University. He holds a doctorate from KIIT and a master’s degree from NIT Rourkela. Beginning his academic career in 2014, he has eight years of teaching experience at KIIT. His research expertise includes EDM, laser welding, and superalloys, with publications in reputed international journals and conferences. He has authored a book titled EOT Crane Model and contributed multiple book chapters. Skilled in software tools such as X’pert HighScore, MINITAB, STATISTICA, ADAMS, SolidWorks, CATIA, and MATLAB, he has taught Engineering Mechanics, Manufacturing Technology, Mechanical Measurement and Control, Metrology and Quality Control, and Material Science. He is keen to continue research in superalloy processing and characterization.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Manufacturing process, Metrology, Solid Mechanics
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Characterization of superalloys, Non-conventional machining, Optimization techniques

name: Dr. Avinash Chaudhary
bio: Research professional with experience of 8+ years in Fire and Combustion Science. Education background includes a Ph.D. on Combustion and Fire Safety from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Roorkee (India), and MS in Thermal Engineering from the National Institute of Technology (NIT), Kurukshetra (India). Currently working as Assistant Professor in School of Mechanical Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), India. Previously worked as postdoctoral researcher at CORIA laboratory, INSA Rouen, France on “Near wall combustion with high temperature materials”, project MATRYSSE and “Behavior of aeronautic composites under flames”, project AEROFLAMME. I was responsible for design and development of a test bench for the reaction to fire of composites used in aeronautics. Research contributions include several peer-reviewed “Research Articles” published in leading International Journals, Conferences. .

COURSE EXPERTISE: Thermal
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Fire dynamics in compartment, Combustion, Optical diagnostics, Phosphor thermometry, Thermal behavior of aeronautics composites, Solar energy
Professional Membership: Membership of Indian Society of Heat and Mass Transfer (ISHMT)

name: Dr. Basanta Kumar Nanda
bio: Dr. Basanta Kumar Nanda is working as Associate Professor in School of Mechanical Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He obtained his B.E degree from National Institute of Technology (Previously REC), Silchar, in Mechanical Engineering. He got his M. Tech from Bengal Engineering College in Production Engineeeing. He has also received his Ph.D degree in Production Engineering from VSSUT, Burla. He has presented a number of papers in different International Conferences in India and abroad. He has also reviewed a number of research papers of International Journals. He has been teaching manufacturing related courses since last twenty-six years.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Production Engg, Metrology, Non-Traditional Maching,Thermodynamics

name: Dr. Bharat Chandra Routara
bio: Dr. Bharat Chandra Routara is a Senior Professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, where he also serves as Chairman of the Central Library Committee. He earned his Ph.D. in Production Engineering from Jadavpur University in 2008. With over 30 years of teaching experience, he has guided seven Ph.D. scholars (five ongoing) and seventeen M.Tech students. Dr. Routara has published over 100 research papers in reputed international journals and presented widely at global conferences. His research focuses on non-traditional machining, cryogenic cooling, surface characterization, and optimization of machinability parameters. He holds an international patent and is a Fellow of The Institution of Engineers (India) and a life member of ISTE, IIIE, and The Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).

COURSE EXPERTISE: Manufacturing Technology, Engineering Mechanics, Operations Research, Engineering Meteology

bio: Dr. Bijaya Bijeta Nayak is an associate professor of school of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. She has completed her doctoral degree from Department of Mechanical Engineering, National Institute of Technology Rourkela, India. She has more than twelve years of experience in teaching. Her current area of research includes advanced manufacturing processes, composite fabrication, process modelling, and quality engineering, Renewable energy resources. She has published more than seventy research papers in international journals and international conferences. Eight scholars have completed their Masters degree under her guidance and three are continuing their Ph. D under her guidance. She has Nine patents published and granted on her credit.

name: Dr. Debjyoti Sahu
bio: Dr. Debjyoti Sahu currently serves as Assistant Professor at School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. Dr. Sahu obtained is B.E. in Automobile Engineering from Malnad College of Engineering Hassan and M.Tech in Energy Systems Engineering from BVB College of Engineering and Technology Hubli, Karnataka. He obtained his PhD in Energy Technology from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India. He has taught various subjects in UG and PG level at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, Bengaluru during 2008-2018. Now he teaches Fuels and Emission, Automobile Engineering and IC Engine and Gas Turbines at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He has been involved in several experimental research including Hydrogen adsorption, Metal organic frameworks, Refrigeration and Bio-digestion. His work on portable bio-digestion is mentioned in an article published by ENSIA, the most popular environment magazine. He has published several papers on refrigeration, adsorption and IC engine performance. Dr. Sahu is a life member of Indian Science congress and Institute of Engineers, India.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Automotive Techology, Battery Technology, Automotive Mechatronics
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Engines and Emissions, Biofuel, Batteries

name: Dr. Sudhanshu Dubey
bio: Dr. Sudhanshu Dubey, is an Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), India. He earned his Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Bombay, MTech. from IIT Guwahati, and B.E. from GEC Bilaspur. His doctoral research pioneered the development of Optimal Laminated Additive Manufacturing (OptiLAM), integrating advanced laser-based techniques with multi-axis automation. Dr. Dubey’s research spans Additive Manufacturing, CNC Technology, Robotics & Automation, and Laser–Material Interaction, with contributions including patents, international publications, and conference presentations. A recipient of multiple academic and research awards, Dr. Dubey continues to drive innovation in manufacturing automation.

name: Dr.Hemalata Jena
bio: Dr Hemalata Jena is an eminent researcher and academic working in the areas of materials science and engineering. She specializes in composites, mainly the mechanical characterization and development of fiber-reinforced composites. Dr. Jena also has propelled the effort with her research on sustainable and high-performance materials, and their role in enhancing material mechanical, machining, tribologocal and durability, amongst other relevant studies, which are gathering a significant number of citations. Dr. Jena has published widely in peer-reviewed journals and has presented her work at multiple international conferences during her career. Her research focuses on the design of sustainable materials consistent with green engineering. As a mentor to students and early-career professionals in Production Engineering, she is also a distinguished educator. Her focus on research and education makes her a respected figure in her field.

name: Dr. Jitendra Kumar Patel
bio: Dr. Jitendra Kumar Patel obtained his Bachelor of Engineering degree in Mechanical Engineering from Chhatrapati Shivaji Institute of Technology Durg, Chhattisgarh in 2010 and completed his Master of Technology from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati in 2012. After obtaining his master’s degree, he continued his research and studies at IIT Guwahati by joining the Ph.D. program in the Department of Mechanical Engineering. He successfully defended his Ph.D. thesis, titled, “A generic and robust numerical framework for multi-phase flows using Volume-of-Fluid/Immersed boundary methods” in 2018. His broad area of research includes computational fluid dynamics, multi-phase flows, fluid-structure interactions, and miscible fluids interaction. Currently, he focuses on the analysis, development, and fabrication of micro-mixers in microfluidics applications involving two miscible fluids interactions. In 2017, he joined the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be university Bhubaneswar as an Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering.

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: B.E. (Mechanical Engineering), M.Tech. (Mechanical Engineering), Ph.D. (Mechanical Engineering)
COURSE EXPERTISE: Fluid Mechanics, Thermodynamics, Heat Transfer, Computational Fluid Dynamics, Microfluidics, Basic Mechanical Engineering, Aviation Fuels and Combustion, Professional Practice, Law & Ethics, Scientific & Technical Writing
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Multiphase Flows, Miscible Fluids Interactions, Microfluidics, Computational Fluid Dynamics, Immersed Boundary Method
Administrative Responsibilities: FIC (International Student’s Relations, SME), Assistant FIC (SAP, SME), Member (Quality Assurance Cell, SME)

name: Dr. Kunja Bihari Sahu
bio: Prof. (Dr.) Kunja Bihari Sahu completed his Ph. D. (Mechanical Engineering) from Jadavpur University, M. Tech. (Thermal Engineering) and B. Tech. (Mechanical Engineering) from University College of Engineering, Burla (presently VSSUT, Burla). He has an experience of more than 33 years in teaching. His major areas of interest include Combustion, Heat Transfer, and applications of Computational Fluid Dynamics in Enclosure problems. He has guided 3 Ph. D. scholars and 17 Master’s dissertation and published more than 30 research articles in peer reviewed international journals, international and national conference proceedings. He is currently a Professor at School of Mechanical Engineering in KIIT Deemed to be University. He has also taken up the position of Dean (UG Programmes) of KIIT Deemed to be University. He occupied important positions like University Academic Council member; Chairman, Board of Studies (BoS) of School of Mechanical Engineering. Prior to this, he served as the Director (Academics) of Spintronic Technology and Advanced Research, Bhubaneswar. Dr. Sahu is a Life Member of Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE), Indian Society for Heat and Mass Transfer (ISHMT), and Indian Science Congress Association (ISCA). He is also a Fellow of Institution of Engineers (India).

He was previously an analyst engineer in TATA Consultancy Services, Pune, India. His research interests include Impingement heat transfer, Nano-particle and nanofluid application in heat transfer, Computational fluid dynamics, Hard Machining, Thermal Systems Design and Optimization and Run-out table in steel rolling mills. He has been teaching thermal engineering related courses in UG & PG level. He has developed many automation tools while serving in TCS and KIIT. He has published 2 international and 1 national patents and 23 research articles in journals / conferences (SCI/SCOPUS).

name: Dr. Mantra Prasad Satpathy
bio: With a specialization in Materials Joining and Characterization, Dr. Mantra Prasad Satpathy brings over 13 years of academic and research experience in advanced manufacturing. Over the years, he has successfully supervised undergraduate and postgraduate projects, and three Ph.D. scholars have been awarded under his guidance. Dr. Satpathy has authored and co-authored over 65 peer-reviewed research articles in reputed journals and holds four published patents. He is the author of the book “Ultrasonic Welding of Metal Sheets,” published by CRC Press. He has delivered several guest lectures across various domains. Dr. Satpathy has also chaired technical sessions at several national and international conferences.

bio: PhD in Mechanical Engineering with 25 years experience in Aeronautical Domain (Gas Turbine Engine). name: Dr. Nilotpala Bej
bio: Dr. Nilotpala Bej is an Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering at KIIT, Bhubaneswar. She holds a B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from UCE Burla, an M.Tech in Thermal Engineering from NIT Rourkela, and a Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur (2015). Her research work focuses on computational fluid dynamics (CFD), including gas liquefaction at cryogenic temperatures, vortex tube gas separation, and winglet aerodynamics. Skilled in ANSYS FLUENT, OriginPro, and Tecplot, she currently guides two Ph.D. scholars, with one receiving a doctorate in 2025. She also serves as Faculty-in-Charge (International Students), CAE Lab, and Tutor-Mentor Committee. A lifetime member of ISTE and ISCA, she is treasurer of ISHRAE Bhubaneswar. She has organized ICAMPD 2019, ATAL FDP 2024, and VAANI 2025.

name: Dr. Nitin Sharma
bio: Dr. Nitin Sharma is an Associate Professor (II), Associate Dean, and Program Head of B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He holds a B.Tech. from IIITDM Jabalpur, an M.E. in Mechanical and Control Engineering from the Tokyo Institute of Technology (Japan) under the MEXT Fellowship, and a Ph.D. from KIIT (2018). With over 60 SCI-indexed papers and 17 Scopus publications (H-index 23, i10-index 44), his research focuses on vibroacoustics, metamaterials, aeroelastic flutter, and composite modeling. He has guided two Ph.D. scholars and led a DST-SERB (TARE) project on acoustic metamaterials. A recipient of KIIT’s Top 5 Researcher Award (2021–22) and the Best Technical Paper Award (2018), he continues to excel in interdisciplinary mechanical research.

name: Dr. Prakash Ghose
bio: Dr. Prakash Ghose is a faculty member in the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT University. After completing his B.Tech, he worked as a Project Engineer at Predominant Engineers Pvt. Ltd., Gurgaon. He later obtained his Master’s degree in Heat Power Engineering from VSSUT, Burla, and subsequently joined KIIT University as a faculty member. Dr. Ghose earned his Ph.D. from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, specializing in combustion, where he worked on a gas turbine combustor project sponsored by GTRE, Bengaluru. His research interests include thermal sciences, combustion modeling, devolatilization kinetics, and CFD-based energy simulations. He also supervises several Ph.D. scholars, focusing on experimental and numerical research in combustion and energy systems.

name: Dr. Pruthwiraj Sahu
bio: Dr. Pruthwiraj Sahu is currently working as an Assistant Professor (II) in the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar since 2014. He has over 14.5 years of teaching experience and two years of industry experience in Annealing area (Operation) at Jindal Steel Plant, Kolkata. He has course expertise in Engineering Mechanics, Machine Dynamics, Strength of Materials, Machine Design (taught to UG students). He has guided many B.Tech. project students and one M.Tech. student as a co-supervisor. He has published a good number of research papers in reputed international SCI journals and presented papers in international conferences. His broad research areas are Development and Characterisation of Hybrid Composite Materials, Structural Analysis (both Static and Dynamic) of Fiber Reinforced Composite Laminates.

bio: Dr R K Sarangi has more than 25 years of experience in teaching, research, consultancy and industry and started his career in Blue Star Ltd. He has graduated form NIT Silchar and subsequent hold M.Tech. and Ph.D. from IIT Bombay. He has published several papers in reputed journals and presented in many national and international conferences. He is also a reviewer for many reputed journals. He is an active member of ISHRAE and currently the student chair of KIIT student chapter. He was also the past student chair of Bhubaneswar ISHRAE sub-chapter. He has work extensively in the areas of refrigeration and air-conditioning, cooling of electronics, microwave components, systems and simulation, modeling of thermal systems. name: Dr. Rahul
bio: Dr. Rahul is an Assistant Professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He earned his Ph.D. from the Department of Industrial Design, NIT Rourkela, and has over seven years of teaching and research experience in India and abroad, including postdoctoral research at Jilin University, China. He has published 13 SCI/WoS and 35 Scopus-indexed journal papers, with two patents published and nine under review. Dr. Rahul received the DST-SERB project as Principal Investigator and an AICTE-ATAL grant to coordinate an FDP on 3D Printing and Advanced Manufacturing. His research interests include advanced manufacturing, micro-machining, cryogenics, welding, material characterization, and process optimization. He is also a Life Member of the Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE).

name: Dr. Rajiv Lochan Mohanty
bio: Dr. Rajiv Lochan Mohanty has one year of industrial and six years of teaching experience. He received his Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He received his M.Tech in Thermal Engineering from National Institute of Technology Silchar, Assam, India. His research areas include Boiling Heat Transfer, Heat Exchanger, Forced & Free Convection, Non-Newtonial Fluid, Nuclear Power Engineering, Droplet Dynamics, Refrigeration & Air Conditioning, and Microchannel. He receives a prestigious project under the Core Research Grant (CRG) from SERB, the Government of India, with a budget of INR 36.14 lakhs. He has published his research work in reputed international refereed journals and proceedings. He receives grants for seven of his patents and files five more. He is also a regular reviewer for refereed journals from well-known publishers.

name: Dr. Ramanuj Kumar
bio: Dr. Ramanuj Kumar has over 12 years of teaching experience. He earned his Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering from KITS Ramtek, Nagpur University, India, in 2009, and his M.Tech. in Manufacturing Engineering from NIT Warangal, India, in 2012. He completed his PhD in Mechanical Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, in 2018. Dr. Kumar is a lifetime member of the International Association of Advanced Materials, the Indian Science Congress, and the Society for Materials Chemistry (SMC). His research areas include hard turning, nanofluid-assisted machining, non-conventional machining, nanocomposites, additive manufacturing, optimization, soft computing and Modelling. He holds three granted patents and has published more than 56 papers in international journals (SCI/ESCI), as well as 70 papers in international and national conferences. His Scopus research profile includes 144 papers, 1,677 citations, and an h-index of 22. Under his supervision, two PhD theses were awarded in 2024.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Metal cutting and Manufacturing
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Machining, Nanocomposites, additive manufacturing, MQL, Nanofluid, optimization, modelling

He earned his Ph.D. from IIT (ISM) Dhanbad and M.Tech. in Machine Design & Analysis from NIT Rourkela, where he received the Institute Silver Medal and Certificate of Merit. He completed his B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering from CET (now OUTR), Bhubaneswar. With over 13 years of teaching and 10 years of research experience, he has taught subjects like Thermodynamics, Machine Design, and FEA. bio: Dr. Behera is currently working as Asst. Professor (II) in the school of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT, Deemed to be University since June 2019. He received his PhD degree in Mechanical Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati in 2019. He completed his M.Tech degree in Mechanical Engineering (Production Engineering specialization) from Jadavpur University, Kolkata in 2009 and later worked as Asst. professor in GHITM, Puri, Odisha from 2010 to 2012. He holds a B.Tech degree in Mechanical Engineering from Indira Gandhi Institute of Technology, Sarang, Odisha in 2007. His research involves bio-ceramic coating, micro-machining, surface modification including surface texturing, surface coating and cladding, laser processing for biomedical applications.

name: Dr. Rishitosh Ranjan
bio: Rishitosh Ranjan is an accomplished academic and researcher in mechanical engineering, with a strong focus on thermal power systems and innovation. He completed his B.Tech at an RTU-affiliated engineering college and qualified for GATE in 2013, subsequently earning his M.Tech in Thermal Power Engineering from NIT Trichy in 2013. Since joining KIIT in 2013, he has been a dedicated faculty member, teaching subjects such as Thermodynamics, Heat Transfer, Fluid Mechanics, IC Engines, CFD, and Turbo Machines, along with interdisciplinary topics like Creativity, Innovation, and Entrepreneurship. In 2022, he earned his PhD from KIIT University, with a thesis on “Numerical and Experimental Investigations of A356 Casting using Cooling Slope Method.” He also contributed to KIIT’s Industry Engagement Cell (2015–2017) and now serves as Associate Dean at KIIT Extension School, leading online program initiatives.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Fluid Mechanics, Thermodynamics, Heat Transfer, IC Engine, Turbo Machine, CFD
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Semi Solid Metal Processing, CFD, Phase Change, Flow Induced Vibration
Administrative Responsibilities: Associate Dean, Online Program, KIITX

name: Dr. Ruby Mishra
bio: Dr. Ruby Mishra received B.E (Mechanical Engineering) from Utkal University in 1999, MTech (Machine Design) from Jadavpur University, in 2007, and Ph.D. (Machine Design) from Jadavpur University in 2014. She has a teaching and research experience of 20 years. Her research interests include Kinematics of Machine and Mechanism, Biomedical Engineering, Biomedical signal and image processing, robotics, medical image analysis. She is a member of The Institute of Engineers and Indian Science Congress Association. She has published 14 national and international patents. She has published many articles that are indexed in Scopus, Web of Science, and Google Scholar. Currently, she is doing research on Biomedical Instruments like Robotic arm for C.T. Guided Biopsy and Single Lumen Microcatheter for Angiography and Embolization. At present, she is working as an Associate Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering Department of KIIT Deemed to be University.

name: Ms. Rupali Das
bio: Rupali Das is currently working as an Assistant Professor (English) in the Dept. of Humanities, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She has one year teaching experience at KIIT. She completed her Masters in English Literature from Banaras Hindu University (BHU), Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh . She is pursuing PhD from National Institute of Technology Rourkela (NITRKL), Odisha. She qualified UGC Junior Research Fellowship (NET-JRF), WBSET, NESLET, MHSET, APSET and TNSET. She had worked as UGC Major Research Project Fellow at Central University of Jharkhand. Her research interest includes Gender and Sexuality Studies, Cultural Studies, Archival Studies, Colonial Historiography, Film Studies and Eco Studies. She has presented several research papers in International Conferences in India and USA as well. She has one book chapter in the Springer, and she contributed a Module for M.A students at IGNOU on Gender Studies. She has reviewed two research articles in Brill Journal.

name: Dr. Sanjib Jaypuria
bio: Dr. Sanjib Jaypuria earned his Ph.D. in Electron and Laser Beam Welding, along with modelling and optimization utilizing Machine Learning methodologies, from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kharagpur, India, in 2021. Prior to this, he completed his M.Tech from IIT Delhi and B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from NIT Rourkela. Dr. Jaypuria gained industry experience at L&T and Tata Motors after completing his B.Tech. His primary research interests revolve around employing machine learning for modelling and soft computing for optimization in manufacturing processes, and 3D Printing. Additionally, he delves into mechanical and metallurgical characterization, robotics, and their various applications. Dr. Jaypuria has authored numerous research papers in International Journals and Conference Proceedings, Book Chapters. He currently serves as an Assistant Professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering at KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, India.

name: Dr. Santosh Kumar Hotta
bio: Dr. Santosh Kumar Hotta completed his Ph.D. in 2023 from the School of Energy Science and Engineering, IIT Guwahati, after earning an M.Tech in Fluid and Thermal Engineering from the Department of Mechanical Engineering, IIT Guwahati, in 2013. His doctoral research was centered on optimizing operating parameters for biogas-fueled spark ignition engines. With over eight years of teaching and research experience, Dr. Hotta has published 11 international journal papers, presented at more than 13 international and national conferences, and authored 5 book chapters. He also serves as a reviewer for the Journal of Renewable Energy, Fuel and INAE. His research expertise spans Fuel-Based Engine Design and Modification, Combustion in CI and SI Engines, GDI and HCCI Engines, Engine Deposits, Renewable fuels (CNG, Biogas, Hydrogen, Ethanol, Methanol, and Ammonia),Waste Heat Recovery, Drying Technology, Computational Fluid Dynamics, and Thermo-Economic Analysis of Engineering Systems.

bio: Dr. Santosh Kumar Nayak is an Associate Professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He earned his Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from KIIT University in 2016. With over 18 years of teaching experience, he has guided 15 postgraduate theses and is currently supervising four Ph.D. scholars. Dr. Nayak has published 17 papers in reputed international journals and holds six national and international patents. His research focuses on impingement heat transfer, nanofluids, computational fluid dynamics, refrigeration, and internal combustion engines. He has presented papers at various national and international conferences and is a Life Member of ISHMT, ISTE, IE (India), and the Indian Science Congress Association.

name: Dr. Shanta Chakrabarty
bio: Dr. Shanta Chakrabarty has been an Assistant Professor at KIIT University since July 2018. She earned her B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from CET Bhubaneswar in 2009 and completed her Ph.D. in Metallurgical Engineering and Material Science at IIT Bombay in 2015. Her research spans crystallographic orientation effects, deformation mechanics, and material behaviour modelling. As a Senior Scientist at SANDVIK ASIA, Pune (2015–2018), she worked on microstructure-property driven projects, weldability enhancement, and magnetocaloric material development. She is skilled in materials characterization (FESEM, EBSD, TKD, TMS, NANOINDENTER, DSC, TEM etc) and computational tools (COMSOL, MATLAB, PAM-STAMP and DD Simulation).Her expertise includes thermo-mechanical behaviour of material, microstructural engineering, and advanced metal-forming. With numerous publications, she has guided 2 Ph.D. and 2 M.Tech students by 2024. Dr. Chakrabarty specializes in materials innovation and mechanical behavior of Material at micro and nano scales.

name: Dr. Smaranika Nayak
bio: Dr. Smaranika Nayak is from Steel city Rourkela. She obtained her B-Tech and M-Tech degree from Odisha’s premiere institute “UCE Burla” presently VSSUT Burla. She had completed her PhD from KIIT University. In 2007, she joined Mahindra Satyam as Design Engineer. She then joined GIFT college in 2009 and SCITM college in 2010 as Assistant Professor. Currently, she is working with School of Mechanical Engineering as Assistant Professor-II. She has been awarded with one Gold and Silver medal for Best Engineering Post Graduate and Best Mechanical Engineering Post Graduate. She has expertise in modelling, assembling and detailed drawing of different industrial and commercial components (GE Home Appliances). Her research centres on the design and development of FRP composites and nanocomposites for automotive applications. She has published many papers in scopus and sci indexed journals. She has reviewed many Elsevier, Springer and MDPI journals.

name: Dr. Spandan Guha
bio: Spandan Guha, currently serving as an Associate Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering at KIIT University in Bhubaneswar, India, since 2018, holds a Master’s (MTech) in Production Engineering from West Bengal University of Technology, India. He completed his Ph.D. at Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India. Actively participating as a member of various governing bodies, including the Institute of Engineers, India, and the Society of Materials Chemistry, his research interests primarily focus on exploring the potential impact of Graphene and its derivatives across different domains, particularly in medical science. Furthermore, he is involved in research on Chemical Vapor Deposition (CVD) and Physical Vapor Deposition (PVD)-based Thin Film Coating, with a specific emphasis on the analysis of mechanical, morphological, and structural properties.

bio: Dr. Suchismita Satapathy is an Associate Professor in the School of Mechanical Sciences, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, with over 20 years of teaching and research experience. She has published more than 130 Scopus-indexed papers in reputed national and international journals and conferences. Her research interests include ergonomics, occupational safety, operations management, operations research, acoustics, sustainability, and supply chain management. She has filed six patents—three published in India, one international, and one granted. Dr. Satapathy has guided four Ph.D. scholars (three ongoing), 20 M.Tech., and 51 B.Tech. students. name: Dr. Sudesna Roy
bio: Dr. Sudesna Roy, an accomplished academic with over 15 years of post-Ph.D. experience, is currently associated with the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University. She holds a Ph.D. from Northeastern University, Boston, and completed post-doctoral research at Boston University. Her academic background includes a B.Tech in Ceramic Engineering from NIT Rourkela and an M.Tech in Metallurgy from IIT Kharagpur. She received the DST Women Scientist Award (2015) and a DST-SERB research grant (2017), and presently leads the DST-FIST Level 1 project at KIIT. Dr. Roy has published widely in reputed journals and conferences. Her research interests include coatings, thin film deposition, cold and thermal spraying, optical materials, and alloy solidification modeling, with extensive expertise in magnetron sputtering and rare earth oxides.

name: Dr. Sumanta Chaudhuri
bio: Dr.Sumanta Chaudhuri is currently working as Associate professor-I in School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT DU. After graduation, he worked as a Scientific Officer in Bhabha Atomic Research Center (BARC) and was involved in design, commissioning and operation of Nuclear Power Plants. His recent research interest is in the area of fluid flow and heat transfer in non-Newtonian fluids, Electro Magneto hydrodynamic (EMHD) pumps, Magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) pumps, Application of analytical and semi-analytical techniques like perturbation method, Homotopy perturbation method(HPM), Adomian decomposition method(ADM), Least square Method (LSM) in fluid flow and heat transfer problems. He has published around 25 papers in Journals and 10 conference papers.

He earned his Ph.D. from the Department of Industrial Engineering and Management, IIT Kharagpur. With over 100 Scopus-indexed publications and 10 book chapters in reputed journals like IEEE, IJPR, and Journal of Cleaner Production, he is a recognized researcher and reviewer for leading international journals. A recipient of multiple Best Researcher Awards from the Institution of Engineers (2017, 2019, 2022, 2024) and others, he also serves as Chief Editor of IJRMET and on the editorial boards of six journals. His research interests include Supply Chain Management, Quality Management, R&D, and Productivity. He is a certified Lean Consultant and Fellow of the Institution of Engineers (India).

name: Dr. Swarup Kumar Nayak
bio: Dr. Swarup Kumar Nayak, Ph.D., is an Associate Professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, with over 12 years of teaching and research experience. He specializes in alternative fuels, renewable energy, biomass conversion, gasification, and combustion studies. A Ph.D. holder from KIIT, he has published 46 journal articles, 10 conference papers, 3 review articles, and 1 book chapter, with over 1,284 citations and an H-index of 23 (as of 2024). His research includes biomass gasification, NOx mitigation, carbon capture, and combustion diagnostics. He has supervised six Ph.D. and two M.Tech. projects. Dr. Nayak is a Life Member of ISTE and Associate Member of IEI, actively contributing to sustainable energy innovation and improving engine performance through renewable and bio-based fuels.

name: Prof. Tarak kumar Sahoo
bio: Prof. Tarak Kumar Sahoo is an Assistant Professor-II in the School of Mechanical Engineering at KIIT University. He holds an M.Tech. from IIT Delhi and is currently pursuing his Ph.D. in the same institution where he teaches. His primary research interest lies in pulverized coal combustion, reflecting his commitment to advancing energy and thermal engineering fields. Prof. Sahoo is deeply engaged in both academic instruction and research, contributing to a robust learning environment. His expertise and dedication make him a key asset in preparing students for the challenges of modern mechanical engineering.s.

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: M.Tech. (IITD) in applied Mechanics (fluid Science), Ph.D. (Pursuing, Combustion)
COURSE EXPERTISE: Fluid Mechanics, Thermodynamics, Heat transfer, IC Engines
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Pulversed Coal Combustion
Administrative Responsibilities:
Hydraulic Machines Laboratory in charge,
Alumni Relations Coordinator,
Member of admission outreach team, SME.

name: Dr. Vijay Kumar Mishra
bio: Dr. V K Mishra studies Porous radiant burners, Non-Newtonian fluids and Micromixers. He explores optimizations methods, Data analysis tools like principle component analysis (PCA) and different types of neural networks for prediction of properties of various thermal problems , and for decision making.

COURSE EXPERTISE: Fluid Thermal
RESEARCH INTERESTS: Thermal radiative heat transfer, Optimization methods, Artificial neural network
Administrative Responsibilities: School level FIC for visiting faculties
Awards and Achievements: Got MHRD, Government of India scholarship for PhD
